text: Larry Eugene Temple (born December 26, 1935) is an American attorney who served as the White House Counsel to President Lyndon B. Johnson from 1967 to 1969. From 1963 to 1967, he was the Executive Assistant to Texas Governor John Connally. In 1957, Temple graduated with a Bachelor of Business Administration degree from the University of Texas. In 1959, he earned a LL.B. degree from the University of Texas School of Law, and graduated Order of the Coif. From 1959 to 1960, he was a law clerk to U.S. Supreme Court Justice Tom C. Clark. Currently, Temple is chairman of the board of trustees of the LBJ Foundation. President Johnson posing with staff 1969. Larry Temple standing 2nd row, 2nd from left. Left to right: Julie Gold, H.W. Brands and Larry Temple at LBJ Library, 2015. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1935 births Category:Living people Category:McCombs School of Business alumni Category:University of Texas School of Law alumni Category:White House Counsels Category:Texas Democrats Category:20th-century American lawyers Category:Law clerks of the Supreme Court of the United States Category:People from Plainview, Texas Category:People from Austin, Texas
title: Larry E. Temple
